page.title: 15PUBLIC BUILDINGS, WILLINGDON
page.content: Polegate Station was moved from its original position to make possible the construction of the "Cuckoo Line" to Tunbridge Wells. Now this line is redundant, there are plans to move the station back again. The majority of shops are in the newer areas: Polegate High Street, Freshwater Square, Lower Willingdon Triangle. Opposite Bank Cottages in Wish Hill, a village pump, erected 1880, has rows of sheep's bones in its surrounding building. Two small hotels cater for visitors: Chalk Farm Hotel and Wannock Hotel. The majority of visitors are hikers, also foreign students who stay with host families in the summer months.40% of 250 families surveyed had accommodated them. Most came from Scandinavia, France, Germany, Italy.
